org.tikv.common.types

Class DataType

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tikv.common.types.DataType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDateTimeType, BytesType, DecimalType, EnumType, IntegerType, JsonType, RealType, SetType, TimeType, UninitializedType

    public abstract class DataType
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Base Type for encoding and decoding TiDB row information.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • convertToTiDBType

        public Object convertToTiDBType(Object value)
                         throws ConvertNotSupportException,
                                ConvertOverflowException
        Convert from Spark SQL Supported Java Type to TiDB Type

        1. data convert, e.g. Integer -> SHORT

        2. check overflow, e.g. write 1000 to short

        Spark SQL only support following types:

        1. BooleanType -> java.lang.Boolean 2. ByteType -> java.lang.Byte 3. ShortType -> java.lang.Short 4. IntegerType -> java.lang.Integer 5. LongType -> java.lang.Long 6. FloatType -> java.lang.Float 7. DoubleType -> java.lang.Double 8. StringType -> String 9. DecimalType -> java.math.BigDecimal 10. DateType -> java.sql.Date 11. TimestampType -> java.sql.Timestamp 12. BinaryType -> byte array 13. ArrayType -> scala.collection.Seq (use getList for java.util.List) 14. MapType -> scala.collection.Map (use getJavaMap for java.util.Map) 15. StructType -> org.apache.spark.sql.Row

        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ConvertNotSupportException
        ConvertOverflowException

      • doConvertToTiDBType

        protected abstract Object doConvertToTiDBType(Object value)
                                       throws ConvertNotSupportException,

      • encodeKey

        public void encodeKey(CodecDataOutput cdo,
                      Object value,
                      int prefixLength)
        encode a Key's prefix to CodecDataOutput
        Parameters:
        cdo - destination of data.
        value - value to be encoded.
        prefixLength - specifies prefix length of value to be encoded. When prefixLength is DataType.UNSPECIFIED_LEN, encode full length of value.

      • isPrefixIndexSupported

        protected boolean isPrefixIndexSupported()
        Indicates whether a data type supports prefix index
        Returns:
        returns true iff the type is BytesType
